options.content:
# marker element support

The marker element can be used to support arrow head positions. It's defined with
attributes refX, refY, markerHeight, markerWidth, viewBox. But dompurify 3.0.8 strips
these attributes off because it expects them to be lowercase. The panel corrects for
this and this dashboard shows the arrow head being correctly positioned.

To double confirm attribute allowance, press SVG in the panel options
and view the final SVG in the console.

options.svg:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="-0.5 -0.5 301 201">
    <defs>
      <marker id="cell-markerArrow" viewBox="0 0 3 3" abcrubbish="true" preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMid meet" markerUnits="strokeWidth" markerWidth="3" markerHeight="3" refX="1.5" refY="1.5" orient="auto">
          <path d="M1,0 L1,3 L2,1.5 L1,0" style="fill: teal" />
      </marker>
    </defs>
    <g>
        <line x1="100" y1="100" x2="150" y2="145" style="stroke-width: 3px; stroke: teal; marker-end: url(#cell-markerArrow);" />
        <line x1="200" y1="100" x2="250" y2="45" style="stroke-width: 3px; stroke: teal; marker-end: url(#cell-markerArrow);" />
    </g>
</svg>
